name: 陳碩漢
objective: This course will detail the working principles and design philosophy of embedded systems and with prime focus on (1) Linux Kernel, (2) Cyber-Physical System, (3) Memory Architecture, (4) Security, (5) Scheduling. Please be noted that the knowledge of the Operating System, C language, and the use of basic Linux commands are required before taking this course. Also, this course will be taught in English and please consider this course as a good chance for you to perfect your English skills.
schedule:
Progress is subject to changes due to holidays or any other incidents.

1.　　Introduction (1 week)
2.　　Linux Kernel (2 weeks)
3.　　Cyber-Physical System (1 week)
4.　　Memory Architecture (2 weeks)
5.　　Virtual File System (2 weeks)
6.　　Midterm (1 week)
7.　　Input/Output (1 week)
8.　　Security (1 week)
9.　　Scheduling (1 week)
10.　　Booting (2 weeks)
11.　　Final (1 week)
12.　　Literature Survey Presentation (3 weeks)
scorePolicy:
1. Students are encouraged to discuss with each other. But if you intentionally commit plagiarism, you will probably fail the assignment or the course.
2. There will be a midterm exam, 5 project assignments, and a survey presentation as the final exam.
3. Midterm -> 30%, Assignments -> 30%, Survey presentation -> 40%.
materials:
Embedded Linux Primer: A Practical Real-World Approach, by Christopher Hallinan, Prentice Hall,
Linux Device Drivers, 2e/3e, by Alessandro Rubini and Jonathan Corbet, O'Reilly
Understanding the Linux Kernel, 2e/3e, by Daniel P. Bovet and Marco Cesati, O'Reilly
